column4: Does anybody know which package installs the two files nautilus-computer.desktop and nautilus-folder-handler.desktop found in /usr/share/applications?
dpkg -S to find out
thanks a lot!
seems to be nautilus itself, but as i already reinstalled it, it does not solve my problem: when I log in, nautilus won't be started, so I have no desktop icons until I start it manually
hmm. you can put it in startup applications. this workaround shouldn't be necessary though.
this would open a nautilus window on startup which is annoying, trying it with dpkg-reconfigure nautilus now once more
still no luck unfortunately. do you have another idea? ;)
does it happen for another user?
nope it works with the account I use for watching movies
movies, right?
i would delete nautilus related settings.
:D :D, no really Movies!, I disabled compiz there and use a different panel configuration, thats the main reason ;)
or even for gnome-session
.nautilus folder is empty, where are the gnome-session settings saved?
look in .gconf and .config. i don't know exactly
okay I'll try that
removed the wohle gconf gnome-session folder, but still no luck. checked again with the other account, which works as expected.
i really don't know. gnome is quirky. maybe compiz is the problem?
already removed --sm-disable from compiz startup today with no luck but I'll restart without compiz at all and we'll see
it did not help, but interestingly I have no window decorations any more when starting without compiz, so there really must be something wrong
that just means it doesn't use metacity
how did you disable compiz?
normally: prefs -> appearance -> visual effects  then select no effects
I started it with a command in startup applications: compiz --replace --sm-disable --ignore-desktop-hints ccp --loose-binding
